title: MV-algebra
summary: In abstract algebra, a branch of pure mathematics, an MV-algebra is an algebraic structure with a binary operation ⊕ {\displaystyle \oplus } , a unary operation ¬ {\displaystyle \neg } , and the constant 0 {\displaystyle 0} , satisfying certain axioms. MV-algebras are the algebraic semantics of Łukasiewicz logic; the letters MV refer to the many-valued logic of Łukasiewicz. MV-algebras coincide with the class of bounded commutative BCK algebras.
